parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name or affiliation. While it mentions "Andrioni Alin" and "Păun Gabriel",  there's no indication these individuals are running for parliamentary office in the current election.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The content discusses a legal case related to the "Râul Alb" (White River), a matter of public interest.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be to inform the public about a legal case involving individuals associated with the "Râul Alb" initiative. There is no explicit or implicit call to vote for or against any candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information about a legal case, resembling a news report or citizen journalism piece. It reports on court decisions and mentions individuals involved in a dispute.  The style and content align with journalistic reporting, aiming to inform rather than persuade voters.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post expresses opinions about the actions of Andrioni Alin and Păun Gabriel, it does so within the context of reporting on a legal case. The opinions are presented as part of the factual reporting, not as a standalone attempt to influence voters.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1025904682673996</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while discussing a matter of public interest related to environmental activism and a legal case, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  It lacks any direct or indirect reference to parliamentary candidates or the ongoing election. The post's objective is primarily informative, reporting on a legal dispute.  The opinions expressed are presented within the context of factual reporting, not as an attempt to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary election.  The targeting parameters (age, location) are broad and do not specifically target voters based on their political affiliations.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Râul Alb</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
